intro: Synaedrys falconeri, commonly known as the Falkland Islands fern, is a unique vascular plant native to the Falkland Islands. It is a member of the family Polypodiaceae, characterized by its fern-like fronds and rhizomatous growth habit. The plant thrives in the cool, temperate climate of its native habitat, often growing in moist, rocky soils. Its reproductive structures include spore-producing sorus clusters on the undersides of its fronds. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
